page.title: 01NORTH DURHAM VILLAGE
page.content: The villages are small with rows of terraced red brick houses. Many of the villages grew up around a coal mine known as a pit. There is a strong sense of community in this area. Many people here like the village community with its close contact with family and friends. Many local organisations such as the Women's Institute, Bowling Club, Drama Club, Badminton Club, Martial Arts Club, Scouts and Guides meet in the local Junior School. Sometimes there are concerts and plays and these are the main forms of entertainment besides the Public Houses. The Public Houses in this area get some trade from visitors but mostly they are Pubs for the local people. There is a strong feeling of community felt in the local Pubs, and there is not much trouble.
